title: Birth rate in Italy 2018 , by region
summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Birth rate per thousand inhabitants for 20 number of Months.
The maximum Birth rate per thousand inhabitants 9.0 is found at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and the minimum is found at Sardinia where Month is 5.7.
The difference of Birth rate per thousand inhabitants between the highest and lowest Month is 3.3.
min_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in each Month on the y axis.
The Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is highest at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and lowest at Month Sardinia.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Birth rate per thousand inhabitants for 20 number of Months.
The maximum Birth rate per thousand inhabitants 9.0 is found at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and the minimum is found at Sardinia where Month is 5.7.
The difference of Birth rate per thousand inhabitants between the highest and lowest Month is 3.3.
max_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Birth rate per thousand inhabitants in each Month on the y axis.
The maximum Birth rate per thousand inhabitants 9.0 is found at Month Trentino-South Tyrol and the minimum is found at Sardinia where Month is 5.7.
The second highest Birth rate per thousand inhabitants is appeared to be the Month Campania.
The highest Month Trentino-South Tyrol has 3.3 more Birth rate per thousand inhabitants than the lowest Month Sardinia.
Month Trentino-South Tyrol is higher than any other Months with value 9.0, followed by Campania, and Sicily. Down to Month Sardinia with the lowest value 5.7.
Over the past 20 Months, the Birth rate per thousand inhabitants has lowered.
Month Lazio, Apulia, Aosta Valley, and Veneto share the same value 7.2.
The Month Sardinia tends to be 1.28 percent lower than average.
